text: A. J. Harris (born August 8, 1984) is a former Canadian football running back. Harris played 44 games over four years at Northern Illinois University, rushing 342 times for 1 616 yards and 12 touchdowns. He also caught 31 passes for 197 yards. He signed as an undrafted free-agent with the Washington Redskins in 2006 and was released during pre-season, spent the spring of 2007 in NFL Europe playing for the Cologne Centurions, and attended training camp with the Seattle Seahawks in 2007. Harris signed as a free agent with the Edmonton Eskimos on February 7, 2008. On August 3, 2009, Harris signed with the BC Lions. On October 10, 2010, Harris signed with the Hamilton Tiger-Cats. ==References== Category:1984 births Category:American football running backs Category:Canadian football running backs Category:Edmonton Eskimos players Category:Living people Category:Northern Illinois Huskies football players Category:Sportspeople from Wheaton, Illinois Category:BC Lions players Category:Cologne Centurions players Category:Arkansas Diamonds players
title: A. J. Harris
